title: Led Zeppelin - 1979.07.23 Copenhagen, Denmark
description:
Led Zeppelin - 1979.07.23 Copenhagen, Denmark   

Artist: Led Zeppelin
Date: 1979-07-23
Venue: Falkoner Theatre 
Location: Copenhagen, Denmark
Source: Audience
(Recorded from the floor using an Uher tape deck and 
sennheiser mics).

Source: 
Excellent audience recording.

Details: 
The instruments are extremely well positioned, the spectrum is 
clear and the sound is dynamic.

Tracklist:

01. Applause
02. The Song Remains The Same
03. Celebration Day
04. Black Dog
05. Nobody's Fault But Mine
06. Over The Hills And Far Away
07. Misty Mountain Hop
08. Since I've Been Loving You
09. No Quarter
10. Hot Dog
11. The Rain Song
12. White Summer
13. Kashmir
14. Trampled Underfoot
15. Achilles Last Stand
16. Guitar Solo
17. In The Evening
18. Stairway To Heaven
19. Rock And Roll

Comments: 
The first show of 1979 and the first ever live performances of 
Hot Dog and In The Evening, this show is very good. Robert is 
a little hoarse and seems almost shy but good nonetheless, and 
except for a messed up solo in Misty Mountain Hop, Page's 
playing is fluid, fast, and wonderful! Bonham and Jones, as usual, 
sound fine. A curious set list that is very refreshing and the 
angry solo in Achilles Last Stand is a highlight. Problems with 
a power generation delayed the show. Band's lightning rig was too 
big for venue and a generator had blown up
